Center: IAEA Nuclear Data Section, Vienna, Austria
ref: Jour: Acta Physica Sinica (Overseas Edition), Vol.2, p.641 (1993)
title: The studies of non-Rutherford backscattering cross sections of 4He from 16O

x4freetext: The studies of non-Rutherford backscattering cross
sections of 4He from 16O

x4codes.hlp: Fudan Univ., Shanghai, China, People`s Rep.

x4freetext: Department of Physics II

x4codes.shortRef: Jour: Acta Physica Sinica (Overseas Edition), Vol.2, p.641 (1993)

x4codes.hlp: Fudan Univ., Shanghai, China, People`s Rep.

x4freetext: NEC 9SDH-2 Pelletron tandem
Thin targets were used in order to reduce the
scattering ions from the substrates. Aluminium
containing natrual oxygen was deposited on a self-
supporting carbon film (40 nm), and then coated with
a layer of 10 nm Ag. Targets of different thickness
were used for the scans over narrow resonances and
over slowly varying portions, with an energy loss of
4 keV and 8 keV,respectively, in an Al2O3 layer for
3MeV alpha particles.
Because the elastic
scattering cross section for Ag is expected to be
essentially  Rutherford even at 9 MeV, the Ag film
can be used as a standard.
Annular surface barrier detector with an
energy resolution of 25 keV.
Another Au-Si surface barrier detector with a
sensitive area of 28mm2 was used.
Beam current monitor, which is a Faraday cup
of 100 cm long and 4 cm in diameter.
Statistical uncertainty
total uncertainty is less that 3%
LV, SD.
SD. Year of publication was changed.
